properties.name: 16th Street Mission BART
properties.description: Posted by Egoodman

properties.name: 327 Henry Street, my old apartment
properties.description: Posted by Egoodman327 Henry St New York NYI was in bed, deliberately oversleeping. I remember hearing a really loud pop-thud sound and thinking, "I don\'t care if the world is ending, I just need 15...more...minutes...in bed." Of course, I just thought it was a gas main exploding. The picture is from a year and a half later, but that\'s about what my bed would have looked like after my roommate dragged me downstairs in my nightgown to see the catastrophe. Right below those blue curtains -- that\'s where I was standing as I watched the second tower fall.

properties.name: Bonneville Dam
properties.description: Posted by EgoodmanGet the tour of the Bonneville Dam generator house. Feel that hum? That\'s hydropower, and some damn good white noise.

properties.name: PDX airport terminal corridor
properties.description: Posted by EgoodmanOnly a few people use the corridor connecting the two terminals of PDX, even though there\'s an extra-convenient people mover. The white noise here is particularly hushed and meditative, especially with the sunlight outside filtered through clouds.

properties.name: Ritual Coffee Roasters
properties.description: Posted by Egoodman  1026 Valencia Street, San Francisco, CA, 94110Demographically correct coffee spot - free WiFi plus Stumptown coffee. Good for meeting friends, not so good for getting work done.

properties.name: Saint Cupcake
properties.description: Posted by Egoodmannw 17th ave portland or 97209Yummy yummy cupcakes - the toasted coconut ones are best. Open til 10pm.

properties.name: Saint's Alp Teahouse
properties.description: Posted by Egoodman39 3rd Ave New York, NY I used to hide here during grad school. I could fritter away entire afternoons on enormous pots of taro tea with tapioca pearls, and little slices of buttered toast. Though there are many Saint\'s Alp locations, this one is conveniently located near many fine classrooms (at NYU, Cooper Union, etc) from which you may want to escape.

properties.name: Saturday ceremony location: Pier 17, the Embarcadero
properties.description: Posted by EgoodmanWe\'ll be getting married here. Parking will be available in the lot between Pier 17 and Pier 15.

properties.name: Siegel's Clothing Superstore
properties.description: Posted by Egoodman 2366 Mission Street, San Francisco CAWhere Mike\'s wedding suit comes from. The only place to buy lime green oxfords, hot pink ties, and all other zoot suit paraphernalia. You know you want one.

properties.name: Sunday picnic location: Dolores Park
properties.description: Posted by Egoodman Dolores St and 19th St, San Francisco, CAOn Saturday, we\'ll be having a daylong get together at the picnic tables at Dolores Park. We\'ll supply the basics, but you might want to bring something to drink and to grill.

properties.name: Trees of Mystery
properties.description: Posted by Egoodman15500 Hwy 101 N Klamath CAAwesome roadside attraction on the 101. Giant Paul Bunyan statue, a much-larger-and-nicer-than-expected collection of Native American handicrafts, and lots of big ol\' trees.

properties.name: Wahtum Lake
properties.description: Posted by Paulirving

properties.name: Yummy Guide
properties.description: Posted by Egoodman358 11th Street Oakland CAThe best place for Hong Kong-style desserts (and dinner) in Oakland. The coconut taro with sago is hot, sweet and delicious. I went there after seeing an Alameda high school production of Cats. And Yummy Guide made everything -- even the bad makeup -- all better.
